comments.raw_text: Fabrice, can you elaborate? In what situations should `MOZ_WIDGET_ANDROID` be used instead of `ANDROID`? Is this information documented? Thanks!
comments.text: Fabrice, can you elaborate? In what situations should `MOZ_WIDGET_ANDROID` be used instead of `ANDROID`? Is this information documented? Thanks!
comments.author: dkeeler@mozilla.com
comments.creator: dkeeler@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text: ANDROID means "the linux flavor used by Android, with bionic", while MOZ_WIDGET_ANDROID identifies the UI toolkit used. Both are defined for GeckoView, but other products like b2g only define ANDROID because they use another widget layer.
comments.text: ANDROID means "the linux flavor used by Android, with bionic", while MOZ_WIDGET_ANDROID identifies the UI toolkit used. Both are defined for GeckoView, but other products like b2g only define ANDROID because they use another widget layer.
